title: As Poland Buries Its Last Communist Leader, An Old Debate Is Dredged
teaser: Poland's last Communist leader, Gen. Wojciech Jaruzelski, has died, leaving Poles a difficult question: What honor befits a man with such a complicated legacy? Konstanty Gebert, a Warsaw journalist, explains.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
